cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west today, expected to turn WNW then NW toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the Mouth of the Mississippi River westward to Cameron, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from the Mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City, LA; Storm Surge Warning Mouth of the Atchafalaya River to Shell Beach, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana coastline and adjacent Mississippi coast; portions of SE Texas coast may experience fringe effects
weather_observation.wind: Port could experience occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) mainly Saturday into early Sunday, highest in exposed areas near Port Arthur.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft possible near Sabine Pass; significant surge (>3 ft) is focused east along the Louisiana coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands on the western flank of Barry could drop 4–6 inches of rain with isolated higher totals, causing localized flooding in and around Beaumont.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands cannot be ruled out Friday night–Saturday.
